result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on May 9, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

01:46 PM Defendant Charles J Charette in court with attorney Ralph David Imholte.  David V. Meany appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   COVID - ZOOM; all parties agree to appear via ZOOM today. 20CF154-- post argnment.. 22CF19-- Atty is not on the case at this time. If no agreement will put cases on trial calendar.  Status conference scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Adjourned initial appearance on February 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

01:00 PM Defendant Charles J Charette in court with attorney Ralph David Imholte.  Defendant Charles J Charette in custody in ACJ.  David V. Meany appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Charles J Charette appeared by video means with Attorney.   COVID - ZOOM; all parties agree to appear via ZOOM today. 20CF154,22CF19-- Atty is on case 20CF154 only. 22CF19 was just filed and atty is not on that case at this time. Bai/bond 21CF154 applies to BOTH cases, State is ok with that. Ct orders-- 22CF19 and 20CF154 are covered under the same bond. 
Atty comments on the case 20CF154- asking for an adjment.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Def shall not possess or consume any mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Def is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold there.
Defendant to have NO CONTACT with J.D. or D.C.
